intro: Byrsonima variabilis f. ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf soursop, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces a fruit similar to the soursop, which is edible and has a tangy flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
